results.title: Charlie Chaplin: The Fireman/Caught in a Cabaret
results.brief_description: In the “Fireman”, Charlie Chaplin stars as a lazy and inefficient fireman.(1916). Also features “Caught in a Cabaret” (1914). Rated: G

results.title: Charlie Chaplin: The Adventurer/the Cure
results.brief_description: Charles Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads” and worked all over England and parts of Europe throughout his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned to that country again in 1912 to 1913 where he was seen by Mack Sennett and joined the Keystone company for $150 per week. This cassette features: “The Cure” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 03
results.brief_description: This compilation video features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “Easy street”: Charlie becomes a policeman and imposes his own brand of order on chaotic Easy Street. “The Immigrant”: Charlie meets a beautiful girl on board a ship. After many hilarious hardships they rescue each other and live happily ever after. “The Cure”: Our hero deposits the contents of his liquor bottle into the curative spa at a Sanatorium. “The Adventurer”: The hectic experiences of an escaped convict, with Charlie starring as the convict.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: This compilation features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “The Pawnshop”: Chaplin stars as the pawnbroker’s assistant. “The Rink”: Chaplin as the waiter. “The Floorwalker” and “One A.M.”: Chaplin as the drunk.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London, of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight, he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads”, and worked throughout England and parts of Europe during his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned again in 1912-13 when he joined the Keystone company. This compilation features four of his short films, The Vagabond”, “The Fireman”, “The Count” and “Behind the Screen.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin is one of the most important people in the history of cinema. From The Kid (1921) to Modern Times (1936), his filmography features groundbreaking and critically acclaimed movies.
results.description:
Charlie Chaplin is one of the most important people in the history of cinema. From The Kid (1921) to Modern Times (1936), his filmography features groundbreaking and critically acclaimed movies.

Aside from being a writer, director, composer and producer, Chaplin is best known as a comic performer and was the first person to popularise feature-length comedies. His slapstick vagrant character ‘the Tramp’ is one of the most iconic performances in movie history and embodies Chaplin’s compassion for the downtrodden. His films often made fun of the wealthy and powerful, likely contributing to Chaplin being blacklisted from Hollywood in 1948 for having Communist sympathies.
description_for_label:

His films often made fun of the wealthy and powerful, likely contributing to Chaplin being blacklisted from Hollywood in 1948 for having Communist sympathies.

results.title: Charlie Chalkman's chalk catcher challenge
results.brief_description: This interactive game is designed for younger children. Set on a chalkboard, the main character Charlie (controlled by the player) tries to catch the falling chalks and fruits to achieve a high score. The player must also avoid the falling erasers, which if touched, rub Charlie out to end the game.

results.title: Charlie's day
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A warning, though in comic style, that pure oxygen is a hazard, and a serious one, when handled without care in hospitals and elsewhere. Charlie, a hospital orderly, creates havoc just in moving a cylinder from storeroom to bedside. The film demonstrates how oxygen makes substances more combustible, even so unlikely a material as steel wool. A film for staff training wherever oxygen is used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Charlie's Country
results.brief_description: Charlie’s Country is a 2013 Australian drama film directed by Rolf de Heer. It was selected to compete in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival where David Gulpilil won the award for Best Actor.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: Place, portraiture, performance
constellations_other.description: The nature of the collaboration between David Gulpilil and Rolf De Heer on Ten Canoes connects the film to their other collaborations, and a number of other works as well.

results.description: Blackfella Charlie is getting older, and he’s out of sorts. The intervention is making life more difficult on his remote community, what with the proper policing of whitefella laws that don’t generally make much sense, and Charlie’s kin and ken seeming more interested in going along with things than doing anything about it. So Charlie takes off, to live the old way, but in doing so sets off a chain of events in his life that has him return to his community chastened, and somewhat the wiser.
description_for_label: Blackfella Charlie is getting older, and he’s out of sorts. The intervention is making life more difficult on his remote community, what with the proper policing of whitefella laws that don’t generally make much sense, and Charlie’s kin and ken seeming more interested in going along with things than doing anything about it. results.title: Charlie's angels [DVD]
results.creator_credit: McG, Nancy Juvonen, Drew Barrymore, Leonard Goldberg and Global Entertainment
results.brief_description: This big screen adaptation of the popular 70s TV series sees the return of the beautiful, brilliant and sassy angels who work for billionaire recluse, Charles Townsend. Together with their fellow colleague, Bosley, they are sent to work when an electronic genius, Eric Knox, is kidnapped. They soon discover even bigger problems are at bay when they realise Knox’s latest technology is a system which can monitor voice communication from anywhere in the world. This is an exuberant action comedy which never takes itself seriously, combining modern day themes with elements of 70s cheese. Cast includes: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Bill Murray, Sam Rockwell, Tim Curry, Kelly Lynch, Crispin Glover and the voice of John Forsythe as Charlie.
